availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David B. Trice (Hopkins County/ Webster County, Ky, farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Arminity Jane Trice. Father of Thomas J. Trice, Sarah E. Trice, Samuel D. Trice, Martha J. Trice, Nancy T. Trice, and Unity S. Trice. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 127A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 716.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 616.
"David B. Trice (1812-1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial #41210722, accessed December 14, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41210722.
